sentences.en: Also, don't hesitate to contact Jane Wheedle at 06 - 5912 - 7384 if you have urgent business.
sentences.cn: 还有,如果你有急事, 也请别犹豫拨 06-5912-7384 与珍·铎联络.

sentences.en: Cross decided to beg and wheedle a bit.
sentences.cn: 克罗斯决定用上点乞求和哄骗。

sentences.en: He managed to wheedle his way into the offices.
sentences.cn: 他连哄带骗地设法进了办公楼。

sentences.en: Hello, this is Dick Richards from Yoyodyne. May I please speak with Jane Wheedle?
sentences.cn: 你好, 我是优达因的迪克·理查. 我要找珍·铎,麻烦你.

sentences.en: I knew he was trying to wheedle me into being at his beck and call.
sentences.cn: 我知道这是他拉拢我,好让我俯首贴耳地为他效劳.

sentences.en: She managed to wheedle an extra day's pay out of him.
sentences.cn: 她花言巧语地骗他多付了一天钱.

sentences.en: She'll wheedle out your secret if you are not careful.
sentences.cn: 如果你不小心,她会骗取你的秘密.

sentences.en: So he tried to wheedle her into Beijie, the elite school.
sentences.cn: 所以他试图哄她去贵族学校北街小学.

sentences.en: They rudely try to wheedle extras or get the bull reduced.
sentences.cn: 他们强词夺理,就是想讨些特惠或打点折扣.

sentences.en: They tried to wheedle her into leaving the house.
sentences.cn: 他们想哄骗她离开这屋子.

sentences.en: They wheedle out of his money.

trans.tran_cn: 诱骗, 哄骗, 骗得
trans.tran_en: to persuade someone to do or give you something, for example by saying nice things to them that you do not mean – used to show disapproval

trans.tran_cn: 骗取（某物），哄骗（某人干某事）
